title: Iowa women's basketball's McKenna Woliczko crosses off long-time goal
description: McKenna Woliczko, a future Hawkeye, is celebrating her McDonald's All-American honor after crossing it off her list of goals.
fullText:
McKenna Woliczko appears to be fully back as herself on the court. The star guard from Archbishop Mitty and a product of San Jose, California, has stepped right back into action and is playing at her usual high level. The Iowa Hawkeyes women's basketball signee is also celebrating off the court a little bit as well.

Woliczko was recently named a McDonald's All-American, a huge honor in the basketball universe, and will be competing in the 2026 McDonald's All-American Game. This honor has been a long time coming for McKenna Woliczko.

Her father, Aaron Woliczko, detailed on X how this goal was set a long time ago by McKenna, back in eighth grade, and is now finally achieved.

Ever since @McKennaDub switched her focus from softball to basketball (8th grade), THIS @McDAAG has been a goal! Wrote it down years ago & today gets to ‚úÖ it off! Time to celebrate with @McDonalds dinner & shake for #McDub pic.twitter.com/xInz57Bjmg

‚Äî Aaron Woliczko (@AWoliczko) February 3, 2026

McKenna Woliczko is no stranger to accolades, as she finds herself among some of the most prestigious lists in the country already. She belongs to multiple player of the year watch lists, as well as a spot on the 2026 Team USA Junior Women's Basketball Nike Hoops Summit roster.

The McDonald's All-American can is set to air on ESPN on March 31, from Glendale, Arizona, and fans can tune in to see McKenna Woliczko take the court at 6 p.m. CT.

Contact/Follow us¬†@HawkeyesWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of¬†Iowa¬†news, notes, and opinions.¬†Follow Riley on X:¬†@rileydonald7

This article originally appeared on Hawkeyes Wire: Iowa women's basketball's McKenna Woliczko crosses off long-time goal

title: Mike Macdonald credits John Harbaugh for shaping him into a head coach
description: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald doesn't think he'd be a head coach in a Super Bowl if not for John Harbaugh.
fullText:
Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald doesn't think he'd be a head coach in a Super Bowl if not for John Harbaugh.

Macdonald spent a decade as an assistant to Harbaugh in Baltimore, and he said that it was Harbaugh who shaped him into the head coach he is today.

"I don't think it's possible to overstate his influence on me," Macdonald said. "I love John Harbaugh. He's one of my biggest mentors. He was willing to take chances on me when other people weren't and invested in me throughout my career. He had a vision for me and my career that I probably didn't have for myself. All the principles that are part of his program, that he's about as a person, resonated with me. Those are a lot of the foundational principles that we brought to Seattle. He's also a great friend, got a great family, I can't say how much I love him."

Macdonald was 26 years old when Harbaugh hired him, and 12 years later he's one of the best head coaches in the NFL. Harbaugh had a lot to do with that.

title: Terrell Williams commends Zak Kuhr for ‚Äòunbelievable job‚Äô calling Patriots defense
description: The Patriots‚Äô defensive coordinator made his first public appearance since his cancer diagnosis at Super Bowl Opening Night.
fullText:
Drake Maye commanded the biggest crowd during the New England Patriots‚Äô appearance at Super Bowl Opening Night on Monday. Mike Vrabel and Stefon Diggs also drew plenty of attention at their respective spots on the risers, as did other big-name players.

Terrell Williams, meanwhile, was not as prominently featured. He did not have a riser, nor any fixed cameras watching his every action over the 60-minute period. And yet, interest in him was still substantial.

For good reason, too: the 51-year-old made his first public appearance since leaving the team with a cancer diagnosis in late September. Having recently been found cancer-free, he joined the Patriots on their trip to Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks.

Williams will not resume his full duties as defensive coordinator yet. However, he will continue keeping a close eye on a unit that has delivered some uplifting moments for him amid personal challenge.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been joyous for me just to watch them, and watch them develop and watch them buy into the message that [Mike Vrabel] is preaching,‚Äù Williams said. ‚ÄúTrust me, I‚Äôve been in this game a long time and it‚Äôs not easy to get people these days to buy in. Vrabes has that unique ability to get them to do that. That‚Äôs the fun thing to watch. I know exactly what he‚Äôs telling them.‚Äù

Head coach Mike Vrabel has been vital in guiding the Patriots in 2025, but assistant Zak Kuhr also filled a critical role with Williams sidelined. The inside linebackers coach took over as defensive play-caller and de facto coordinator.

Their ability to adapt on the fly has allowed the Patriots to not skip a beat defensively. For Williams, it all comes back to the staff chasing a common goal ‚Äî and to Kuhr being up to the task as well.

‚ÄúWe all believe in the same things. The message has been the same throughout, from the time we got there to the time we met today,‚Äù Williams said.

‚ÄúSo, whether it‚Äôs Zak, or whether it‚Äôs Scott Booker, or whoever it is, we‚Äôre all preaching the same message. Sometimes, when you coach in this league, you‚Äôve got coaches who are pulling in different directions. Everybody has a motive. The only motive for us was to improve. Not to win, but to improve. We figured that the improvement would come, but Zak has done an unbelievable job.‚Äù

For Kuhr, moving into an elevated role early in the regular season was not entirely unfamiliar. He had also filled in for Williams during the offseason, when the nominal DC spent three months away from the team due to an unrelated medical condition.

Nonetheless, the Patriots defense and its coaches kept chugging along. In the postseason, the group has played its best football to date.

Leading the way is Zak Kuhr, and the Patriots offensive coordinator is happy to see it.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm proud of him,‚Äù said Williams. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking forward to him calling this game on Sunday.‚Äù

title: Commanders' anniversary almost no one celebrates
description: Four years ago, the "Commanders" were born. It's an anniversary that most Washington fans would like to forget.
fullText:
"We are the Commanders," announced former Redskins quarterback Doug Williams.

That was on February 2, 2022, on NBC's Today Show, with then-team president Jason Wright overseeing how the name would be announced. Wright was there along with Williams and defensive tackle Jonathan Allen. When it came time for the big unveiling, Wright boringly turned to Williams and said, "Doug, what is it?" Williams then spoke those unfortunate words, "We are the Commanders."

Wright had been hired and was immediately trying to demonstrate a great vocabulary, assuring his listeners of his past success and business acumen. It was all presentation. "Image is everything" to the impressionable. Wright, who was in charge of the franchise's business side, then displayed, for three years, an abundance of oversight failures as one thing after another on the business side became increasingly disappointing.

Owner Daniel Snyder and Wright originally came up with something really "creative" after dumping "Redskins," which had been the team name since 1933. The two geniuses came up with the "Washington Football Team."

Imagine that an NFL football team named itself the "Football Team." Of course, it was mocked and ridiculed by many across the nation. The two guys who thought they were smarter than everyone else they employed had managed to make Washington the only NFL team without an official mascot. Think about it. Isn't it still hard to believe they never saw that as a major red flag?

‚Äî Mauro Rmz (@ArconsaRmz) February 2, 2022

How did we get to "Commanders"? Early, Wright announced the team would never return to "Redskins." Then he announced that "Warriors" would never be considered. This was ironic because "Warriors" was the first name that many in the fan base had expressed excitement about on social media. Then Wright said "Wolves" was also ruled out as was "Redwolves" though, that too had generated fan interest.

Wright had some hired hands (now gone) who somehow saw "Commanders" as the suitable replacement for "Redskins." They, like Wright, showed little to no appreciation for the franchise's history. Wright got rid of the franchise's historic throwbacks and introduced alternate uniforms that had absolutely nothing to do with Redskins' history. It was all clearly intentional.

But then Wright even went a step further, when he claimed, "Commanders was "something that broadly resonated with our fans." He smoothly slipped that claim into his presentation. Did it? To this day, how many in the fan base have you met who suggested and supported "Commanders" before the announcement?

Ah yes, February 2, 2022 (2-2-22) four years ago Monday... is the name any better today?

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: Four years ago, new name was revealed

title: Davis Webb won't become New York Giants' OC, opts to remain in Denver
description: Davis Webb will not become offensive coordinator of the New York Giants, opting instead to remain with the Denver Broncos following a promotion.
fullText:
The New York Giants have suffered another setback in their search for an offensive coordinator, as Davis Webb has opted to remain with the Denver Broncos in a promotion rather than join the team in East Rutherford.

Webb, a former Giants third-round draft pick in 2017 who started one game for Big Blue in the 2022 season finale, interviewed for the vacant OC position under new head coach John Harbaugh.

The Giants requested the interview in late January, viewing Webb's rising reputation -- bolstered by his work developing quarterbacks like Russell Wilson and Bo Nix in Denver -- as a strong fit for guiding young signal-caller Jaxson Dart.

However, on Monday, the Broncos promoted Webb from passing game coordinator and quarterbacks coach to offensive coordinator, filling the vacancy created by the recent firing of Joe Lombardi following Denver's deep playoff run.

Sources: Denver‚Äôs passing game coordinator Davis Webb has reached agreement to become the Broncos‚Äô offensive coordinator. Webb interviewed for three head coaching jobs during this hiring cycle, had other offensive coordinator opportunities, but opted to remain with the Broncos. pic.twitter.com/pYVZTJPNWD

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) February 2, 2026

This decision allows Webb to stay under head coach Sean Payton, another ex-Giant, where he has thrived since joining the staff in 2023 after retiring from playing.

The Giants had hoped to pair Harbaugh with Todd Monken, his former OC in Baltimore, but Monken took the Cleveland Browns head coaching job. The team has conducted virtual interviews with other candidates, including Jim Bob Cooter, Kliff Kingsbury, Brian Callahan, and Alex Tanney, with in-person meetings expected soon for finalists.

While Webb's familiarity with the organization and his offensive acumen made him an intriguing option, his choice to accept the Broncos' promotion leaves the Giants continuing their pursuit of a proven play-caller to elevate the offense.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: Davis Webb won't become New York Giants' OC, opts to remain in Denver

title: New signing Zaragoza taunts Lazio in first Roma interview
description: New Roma signing Bryan Zaragoza says the opportunity to join the Giallorossi came ‚Äòfrom one day to another‚Äô and can‚Äôt wait to debut at the Stadio Olimpico: ‚ÄòLazio games don‚Äôt even come close...
fullText:
New Roma signing Bryan Zaragoza says the opportunity to join the Giallorossi came ‚Äòfrom one day to another‚Äô and can‚Äôt wait to debut at the Stadio Olimpico: ‚ÄòLazio games don‚Äôt even come close.‚Äô

Roma signed Zaragoza from Bayern Munich on loan with an option to buy on deadline day.

The Spanish winger, 24, had spent the first part of the campaign on loan at Celta Vigo.

Bryan Zaragoza with Roma director Frederic Massara (asroma.com)

‚ÄúIt happened from one day to another. I was told Roma was an option, and I never had any doubt and said I wanted to come,‚Äù the Spaniard said in his first interview with Roma.

‚ÄúI want to thank the club, the owners, and everyone for giving me this opportunity.

‚ÄúI have high expectations; I want to be important in this club and win titles. I hope we can return to the Champions League.‚Äù

Scorer of two goals in 26 appearances across all competitions in the first half of 2025-26, Zaragoza can‚Äôt wait to play under Gian Piero Gasperini.

‚ÄúI know Gasperini because I really liked how his team played last season. It seemed very attractive to me. They played the ball really well, and I can‚Äôt wait to start this journey and see what it can give me to learn with him,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve always liked to dribble, like street football. It‚Äôs one of my qualities.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know much about Rome; I‚Äôve never been there before, but people say great things about the city. I come with a great desire to know everything and stay a long time here.‚Äù

Zaragoza has already met Roma star Paulo Dybala at Trigoria.

‚ÄúI met him as soon as I arrived at the training centre and spoke to him. He‚Äôs a great player, and I like the idea of sharing the dressing room with him,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúIn Spain and Germany, I couldn‚Äôt pick numbers higher than 25,‚Äù he explained.

‚ÄúHere, I was attracted by the idea of getting a higher number. I liked the 97, and my family and I decided it was what we wanted to pick.

VIGO, SPAIN ‚Äì OCTOBER 23: Bryan Zaragoza of RC Celta de Vigo warms up prior to the UEFA Europa League 2025/26 League Phase MD3 match between Real Club Celta and OGC Nice at Estadio Abanca Balaidos on October 23, 2025 in Vigo, Spain. (Photo by Jose Manuel Alvarez Rey/Getty Images)

‚ÄúI‚Äôve played in the Liga and Bundesliga. I had not thought about coming to Serie A; it happened suddenly. I can‚Äôt wait to start and learn this league with great players and clubs. It‚Äôs a difficult league, but I‚Äôll try to be successful.‚Äù

Zaragoza made his senior Spain debut in 2023 and has one goal in three appearances under his belt. Naturally, he hopes that his time in Roma will help him get a spot in the squad for the 2026 World Cup.

‚ÄúYes, last season I was quite involved, regardless of my injury,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThis season it hasn‚Äôt happened yet, but I hope the chance will come soon. To be at the World Cup is one of my targets.‚Äù

Zaragoza has already seen the Olimpico when he was at Bayern Munich, as he was an unused substitute in a Champions League match in 2024.

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt even come close because that day I played against Lazio, but I think playing against Roma or Lazio doesn‚Äôt feel the same,‚Äù he admitted.

‚ÄúI want to see the Olimpico full of Roma fans and feel their passion. I can‚Äôt wait to make my debut in this stadium, and my biggest desire is to debut with a win. If I even score, I‚Äôd be perfect.‚Äù

title: Ranking Serie A‚Äôs biggest spenders in 2026 winter transfer window
description: Lazio were the biggest spenders in Serie A during the winter transfer window, while Juventus were the only club not to spend a penny as they secured Jeremie Boga and Emil Holm on free loan deals.The w...
fullText:
Lazio were the biggest spenders in Serie A during the winter transfer window, while Juventus were the only club not to spend a penny as they secured Jeremie Boga and Emil Holm on free loan deals.

The winter transfer window for Serie A clubs ended on Monday, February 2, so it‚Äôs time to review the activity of every team in Italy‚Äôs top flight, including how much they spent over the last month.

LECCE, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 24: Kenneth Taylor of SS Lazio during the Serie A match between US Lecce and SS Lazio at Stadio Via del Mare on January 24, 2026 in Lecce, Italy. (Photo by Marco Rosi ‚Äì SS Lazio/Getty Images)

Lazio had been imposed a transfer embargo during the summer transfer window, so it is not entirely surprising to see the Biancocelesti spend more than any other club in Italy during the January window.

Furthermore, Maurizio Sarri saw two regular starters, Matteo Guendouzi and Valentin Castellanos, leave the Olimpico last month, so the Bianconcelesti had to sign replacements in central midfield and attack.

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì JANUARY 18: Niclas Fullkrug of AC Milan celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs first goal during the Serie A match between AC Milan and US Lecce at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on January 18, 2026 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Marco Luzzani/Getty Images)

As reported by Transfermarkt, Milan spent ‚Ç¨8m to sign promising Verona midfielder Alphadjo Ciss√®, 19, who was then sent to Serie B side Catanzaro on loan.

The Rossoneri also signed Niclas Fullkrug from West Ham, on loan with an option to buy.

title: Alyssa Thomas keeps Laces in first place at Unrivaled, while Sonia Citron‚Äôs outburst was not enough for Hive
description: Laces beat Mist in the Unrivaled 1st-place battle, while Vinyl outlasted Hive, despite the best efforts of Sonia Citron.
fullText:
Laces came out roaring and ready to reassert sole (or Solemates‚Äô?) claim to first place in the Unrivaled standings on Monday night. Yet, their eventual 67-62 win over Mist would not be as easy as it might have looked early on.

Up 15-8 after a defensively-tilted first quarter, Laces maintained a comfortable margin as the offenses came alive in the second, up by nine points, 36-27, at the half. Alyssa Thomas already had tallied a double-double for the Solemates, with 10 points and 10 rebounds.

we got a BATTLE in on TNT rn üëÄ pic.twitter.com/0fiFIXWj3l

‚Äî Unrivaled Basketball (@Unrivaledwbb) February 3, 2026

The third quarter, however, belonged to Mist. And more specifically, it belonged to Arike Ogunbowale.

Ogunbowale ignited for one of her signature scoring eruptions, responsible for 12 of Mist‚Äôs 27 points in the period. Supported by a couple of 3s from Breanna Stewart and Veronica Burton, Mist was down by just a single point entering the fourth, 55-54. A late Thomas free throw gave Laces the lead after seven-straight points from Ogunbowale and Allisha Gray had pushed Mist ahead.

When the fourth began, Laces would expand on that slight edge.

Naz Hillmon, who had just three points through three quarters, scored the first six points for Laces, which were balanced by a single bucket from Mist. Naz‚Äôs efforts put Laces just five points away from the 66-point target score.

A triple from Gray brought Mist within striking distance before two scores from Thomas set up Jackie Young to finish the job for Laces.

AT earned Player of the Game honors, finishing with a season-high 20 points, 11 rebounds, four assists and three steals. It was an all-round, stat-stuffing effort exemplary of The Engine. Ogunbowale‚Äôs 17 points led Mist, with Stewart finishing with 16 points and nine boards.

At 7-2, Laces exit Week 4 atop the standings, with 6-3 Mist falling into third place, as Phantom, also at 6-3, has the head-to-head advantage over the Misties.

It‚Äôs been a rough Unrivaled rookie season for Sonia Citron.

After her seemingly seamless transition to the WNBA, Citron‚Äôs 3-point stroke has been off in Unrivaled, with her shooting struggles exacerbating the overall challenges Hive has faced in their inaugural Unrivaled season.

On Monday night, Soni had her long-awaited Unrivaled breakout. She scored 32 points, going 12-for-18 from the field and 4-for-7 from 3. She also contributed five assists, two blocks and a steal.

Unfortunately, Citron‚Äôs stellar night was not enough for Hive, as Vinyl prevailed 74-71 in the back-and-forth affair.

This one was tight from the jump, and would feature 11 lead changes and 13 ties. Vinyl‚Äôs balance, however, overcame not only Citron‚Äôs big game, but also a huge double-double from Monique Billings, who finished with 23 points and 15 rebounds for Hive.

Five members of Vinyl scored in double figures, led by Rae Burrell‚Äôs 18 points. Burrell, who made two 3s and added three assists, three assists and a block, showed that her Saturday star turn was not an outlier, earning her second-straight Player of the Game honor. Dearica Hamby contributed 14 points and eight boards, while Rhyne Howard dished seven assists, her Unrivaled career-high, to go with her 10 points.

Vinyl entered the fourth up 63-59, as a Brittney Griner bucket as the third quarter expired seemed to set the club up to take control and cruise to the 74-point target score. Citron had other ideas, striving to singularly drag Hive to victory with 10 points in period, including a 3-pointer that pulled her club within one point of Hive, 72-71, and within three points of the target. With a stop, Hive would have the chance to steal the win.

Howard turned on her aggression on Vinyl‚Äôs next possession, driving at Citron. Rhyne missed, but a somewhat questionable foul called on Citron sent Howard to the line. Rhyne sunk the free throw to secure the game for Vinyl, keeping the now 4-5 club in position for a playoff berth.

title: Barcelona one step away from renewing 16-year-old La Masia jewel
description: Barcelona are moving closer to securing one of the most promising midfielders in their youth system, with 16-year-old Hugo Garces on the verge of renewing his commitment to the club.¬†According to SPO...
fullText:
Barcelona are moving closer to securing one of the most promising midfielders in their youth system, with 16-year-old Hugo Garces on the verge of renewing his commitment to the club.

According to SPORT, talks between both parties are progressing smoothly, and confidence is growing that an agreement will be finalised soon.

Garces has been part of Barcelona‚Äôs academy setup since the summer of 2021, when he arrived from Zaragoza to join the Under-12s.

Since then, his development has followed a steady upward curve, earning him recognition as one of the standout midfield profiles in La Masia.

In his early years at the club, Garces was often compared to Thiago Alcantara due to his technical quality, close control, and ability to dictate play in tight spaces.

However, as his game has evolved, his style has taken on a more dynamic edge. Today, his profile is seen as closer to that of Gavi, particularly in terms of intensity, physical bravery, and his willingness to attack the box.

Right-footed and similar in height to the Barcelona midfielder, Garces combines creativity with aggression.

Hugo Garces is close to signing a new contract with Barcelona. (Picture courtesy: Instagram/@h.garcees.10)

As of today, Barcelona are keen for Garces to sign his first professional contract as soon as possible.

Having turned 16 last month, he is now legally eligible to do so, and the club see this as a priority.

Internally, there is full alignment between Bar√ßa and the player. Garces is said to be completely committed to the club, where he has grown both as a footballer and as a person.

While the midfield pathway to the first team is highly competitive, those who follow his progress closely highlight one trait above all else: confidence.

Garces plays with personality, belief, and a winning mindset, qualities that often separate good youth players from those capable of making the final step.

Negotiations are not yet formally closed, but only minor details remain. If everything goes according to plan, Barcelona will soon have another key academy talent tied down as part of their long-term sporting vision.

title: Chelsea star could miss Arsenal clash through compassionate leave
description: Estevao is a doubt to face Arsenal with Chelsea on Tuesday night after Liam Rosenior confirmed the youngster has been on compassionate leave.Photo by Mike Hewitt/Getty ImagesEstevao has been an increa...
fullText:
Estevao has been an increasingly important player for Chelsea this season, and he‚Äôs already started two games against Arsenal in 2025/26. If ready and available, the expectation would be that he‚Äôd be in the lineup at the Emirates Stadium on Tuesday night too.

But the 18-year-old missed Chelsea‚Äôs match against West Ham United on Saturday due to a personal matter, and Liam Rosenior admitted on Monday that he doesn‚Äôt know whether the player will be back for Arsenal.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know yet,‚Äù Rosenior confirmed. ‚ÄúHe is a young kid who has come and been magnificent. He is going through a really difficult time for personal reasons and is on compassionate leave.‚Äù

‚ÄúI won‚Äôt put any pressure on him,‚Äù Rosenior added. ‚ÄúIt has to be right for him and he has to feel in the right place to perform for this team.‚Äù

Chelsea will also be without Jamie Gittens, who will miss out on the chance to play against Arsenal for the third time in a row.

Gittens was benched in the Premier League game at Stamford Bridge, he was ill for the semi-final first leg, and he‚Äôs now picked up a hamstring injury. It‚Äôs likely Pedro Neto and Alejandro Garnacho will start if Estevao is also unavailable.

Chelsea‚Äôs gigantic squad will also be without some other players through injury, with Levi Colwill, Dario Essugo, Tosin Adarabioyo, Romeo Lavia, and Mykhailo Mudryk ruled out, and goalkeeper Filip Jorgensen 50/50 to return.

But none of those are new absentees, and most of Chelsea‚Äôs first-choice team should be available.

title: Real Madrid handed triple injury boost ahead of Valencia trip
description: Real Madrid could head into their upcoming league trip to Valencia with a significantly reinforced squad, as several key defenders edge closer to a return.¬†According to a positive update from MARCA, ...
fullText:
Real Madrid could head into their upcoming league trip to Valencia with a significantly reinforced squad, as several key defenders edge closer to a return.

According to a positive update from MARCA, the likes of Antonio Rudiger, Trent Alexander-Arnold, and Ferland Mendy are all expected to be available if everything progresses as planned.

The timing could hardly be better for Alvaro Arbeloa, who has been dealing with defensive instability in recent weeks.

Real Madrid will travel to Mestalla knowing that solidity at the back will be crucial against a Valencia side that traditionally raises its level at home.

Among the potential returnees, Rudiger‚Äôs comeback stands out as particularly important.

This is because with Eder Militao ruled out until at least March, the German international is viewed as the most reliable option to anchor the defence.

Beyond his physical presence, Rudiger offers leadership and authority, qualities Arbeloa values highly both on the pitch and in the dressing room.

Mendy is likely to return this weekend. (Photo by Angel Martinez/Getty Images)

Mendy‚Äôs possible return also provides a welcome balance.

While the Frenchman is not known for his attacking output, his defensive discipline has long been one of his strongest attributes.

In matches where control and positional awareness are vital, Mendy‚Äôs presence gives Real Madrid a level of security that few alternatives can match.

The situation surrounding Alexander-Arnold, who has returned to training for a while now, is slightly more complex.

The England international‚Äôs start to life in Madrid was promising, with regular appearances early in the campaign, but injuries soon disrupted his rhythm.

As the season progressed, those physical setbacks prevented Alexander-Arnold from fully establishing himself. Now, his return comes with added pressure.

He is eager to accumulate minutes, aware that his place in Real Madrid‚Äôs plans, as well as in the England squad for the World Cup, depends heavily on staying fit and contributing consistently.

If all three players are included in the squad against Valencia, Arbeloa will finally have more experienced options at his disposal.

title: USC basketball report, February 3 - Trojans thrive across the board
description: The Trojan women's guards played well once again and got two wins, while Ezra Ausar dominated the paint against Rutgers and helped the men win
fullText:
Women's basketball took care of business at USC. The Women of Troy secured two wins due to great guard play. For the men, transfer guard Kam Woods had an elite performance get spoiled, but Ezra Ausar led the Trojans to a victory to bounce back from a devastating loss to Iowa. In the NBA, two Trojans shined and represented USC to the best of their abilities.

Here are my top performers across hoops this past week for USC, both in college and the NBA:

Jazzy Davidson was her usual elite self, as she posted 21 points, 8 assists, and 2 steals in the victory over Iowa earlier in the week. Versus Rutgers in the blowout win yesterday, Davidson stuffed the stat sheet, leading the Trojans with 16 points, 9 rebounds, 5 assists, and 3 steals. Davidson has been a model of consistency, and this week the wins followed her stellar performances.

Kara Dunn had yet another impressive week. Dunn vs the Hawkeyes on Thursday had a team-leading 25 points, 12 rebounds, and 5 assists. Against Rutgers in the win Sunday night, Dunn led the team once again with 18 points and 6 rebounds. She continues to be the star of this season alongside Jazzy Davidson.

On Wednesday, transfer Kam Woods tried to take matters into his own hands vs Iowa. Woods put up 33 points, 4 steals, and only missed 5 of his 17 shots. It was a great showing for Woods, who made the most of his opportunity that night. He single-handedly beat the Trojans in a tight distance and gave USC a chance to pull off another big upset in conference. Unfortunately, Woods' stellar night was outshone by a devastating loss.

Ezra Ausar had himself a modest performance on Wednesday in a loss to Iowa. In the Trojans game following their loss, Ausar showed up big time. Ausar led the Trojans to victory with 21 points, 7 rebounds, and 1 steal. He was the consistent star the Trojans needed, and he dominated the paint all night long. When he is effective, and he is having a confident night, the Trojans, like on Saturday, come out on top.

No Keyonte George, no problem. In his first start of the season, Collier stepped up big with 19 points, 7 assists, and 2 steals. Collier was consistent in scoring this past week, reaching double figures each game. It was not just his scoring either, he was an elite facilitator posting at least 6 assists in each of the 4 games this past week. He had success defensively, having a 4-steal game on Wednesday. The Jazz should have the utmost confidence in Isaiah Collier as he continues to make an impact on both ends of the court.

DeMar DeRozan turned back the clock this past week. Derozan had two 30-point games this past week, one of which came yesterday as he dropped 32 on 10-16 shooting. He also had a 25-point performance with 8 assists in the battle vs the 76ers that resulted in a game-winning basket by Tyrese Maxey. Any good performance Derozan has does not correlate to his team winning games, it just correlates to his trade value growing. With a week like this past week, DeRozan can be on his way to playing for a contending team.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Top USC basketball performers in college hoops and NBA, February 3

title: Rio Ferdinand shares what he‚Äôs hearing about Benjamin Sesko inside Man Utd training ground
description: Benjamin Sesko came up with the biggest goal of his Manchester United career so far in the 3-2 win against Fulham. The Slovenian forward joined United in August, having made no secret of his desire to one day play for the club.
fullText:
Benjamin Sesko came up with the biggest goal of his Manchester United career so far in the 3-2 win against Fulham.

The Slovenian forward joined United in August, having made no secret of his desire to one day play for the club. He was thrilled to make it happen.

The six-year interest the Red Devils showed in Sesko appears to be yielding positive results, demonstrating the commitment of both the club and the player.

The 22-year-old has already scored six goals for the club, with four coming in 2026 alone. Despite not yet starting a game under Michael Carrick, he has managed to find form and consistency.

And his powerful finish against Fulham not only gave United a lead but also brought out a huge reaction from the crowd and his teammates.

Sesko‚Äôs goal kept Manchester United‚Äôs run going under Carrick and underlined the kind of presence he can have in front of goal.

The Slovenian striker looks to be playing with more belief lately, and any early concerns from fans seem to have faded away.

Former United defender Rio Ferdinand expressed his delight for Sesko on his YouTube channel, noting that he had received encouraging updates from Carrington about the No. 30.

The former centre-back said: ‚ÄúWhat I would say about him from people on the training ground is his attitude is first class.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs in every day, early, ready to prepare for training, ready to do the extras before training, getting his body right, to make sure that he‚Äôs ready to go out there and give his best every day in training, no stone is left unturned.

‚ÄúAnd they say especially for a young kid, his mindset and his attitude has been first class.‚Äù

The celebrations following Sesko‚Äôs stoppage time winner were no surprise according to Ferdinand. The squad was clearly happy for him.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why you see the guys in the changing room raring about on the pitch reacting to his goal in the way that they were all so happy for him.

‚ÄúYou only get that type of reaction when they go, ‚Äòyou know what? He‚Äôs likable, and you must be a good kid, and you must show traits of someone who works really hard‚Äô.

‚ÄúSo good luck to him, man. I want him to do well.‚Äù

Sesko is pushing for more minutes at Manchester United but faces a tough challenge in Bryan Mbeumo, who has been in good form.

With limited opportunities, he has had to be patient and make the most of his chances. His last two goals have both come off the bench.

Ferdinand truly believes Sesko can be the long-term answer for Man United‚Äôs striker position, as he said: ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs got all the attributes you‚Äôd want in your number nine, by the way, modern day player.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs big, he‚Äôs strong, he‚Äôs athletic, he‚Äôs agile, he‚Äôs got a clean strike.‚Äù

title: Caleb Williams' best offensive lineman gets recognized for his play
description: Caleb Williams' top offensive lineman, Joe Thuney, is a finalist for protector of the year. Thuney helped Caleb and Ben Johnson revive the Bears
fullText:
Caleb Williams was sacked 68 times last season, the highest in the NFL. Caleb Williams was unable to show what he showed this season due to coaching and the offensive line being downright atrocious. Ryan Poles ensured to fix both last offseason.

That, in fact, he did complete both. The Bears' offensive line gained 4 new starters, and the Bears hired the most sought-after coach in the coaching cycle. Ben Johnson and Caleb Williams will get a lot of credit for turning this team into a winner early, but trading for Joe Thuney, a proven winner, made a huge impact as well. The rest of the league recognized that, as he was named a finalist for protector of the year.

In a recent Bears Wire article, Alyssa Barbieri breaks down the impact of Joe Thuney on the Bears this season and Caleb's initial reaction to his best offensive lineman getting recognized:

"Thuney helped anchor one of the best offensive lines in the NFL and played a huge role in the¬†Bears¬†going 11-6, winning the NFC North and beating the¬†Green Bay Packers¬†in the wild-card playoffs. Thuney was named First-Team All-Pro and earned a Pro Bowl nod for his impressive outing in 2025. In 17 games, Thuney allowed zero sacks, one hit and 15 pressures and was only penalized twice. He played 1,149 offensive snaps, the second-most of any guard in the league, per Pro Football Focus."

"As a result, Thuney was nominated for the NFL's first ever Protector of the Year award, alongside¬†Denver Broncos¬†tackle Garrett Bolles and guard Quinn Meinerz,¬†Miami Dolphins¬†center Aaron Brewer, Kansas City Chiefs center Creed Humphrey, and¬†Detroit Lions¬†tackle Penei Sewell. Thuney's quarterback Caleb Williams took to Instagram to celebrate Thuney's nomination and gave him the ultimate praise.

"Best in the world!" Williams wrote on Instagram.

"Williams was the main beneficiary of the overhaul of the offensive line with the additions of Thuney, Jonah Jackson, Drew Dalman and rookie Ozzy Trapilo. But Thuney continues to show, even after 10 years, that he's still one of the best in the game, and Williams will still have him blocking for him for the next few years."

In his rookie season, it was a season full of "his o-line is not giving him any help" and many other excuses as to why his play did not match the player many thought would be coming out of USC. This season, the Caleb Williams that lit it up at USC was seen a whole lot on the field, terrorizing defenses because of how good Joe Thuney and the rest of the offensive line were.

Caleb avoided his fair share of sacks, but he was confident and able to be that superstar quarterback because he was confident in Joe Thuney and company. Other than drafting Caleb Williams, trading for Joe Thuney has to be the best move Ryan Poles has made in his tenure as Bears GM. Caleb Williams recognized Thuney's impact, as well as the rest of the NFL does too.

Joe Thuney blocked for championship-winning quarterbacks and all-time greats Tom Brady and Patrick Mahomes. Caleb Williams, if he keeps up with where he is headed, he can join that tier of guys and be the next winning quarterback Joe Thuney blocks for.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Caleb Williams, Bears took big step forward because of Joe Thuney

title: Lascelles leaves Newcastle for Leicester
description: Defender Jamaal Lascelles leaves Newcastle United after nearly 12 years to join Leicester City.
fullText:
Defender Jamaal Lascelles has left Newcastle United after nearly 12 years to join Leicester City on a deal that runs until the end of the season.

The 32-year-old made 253 appearances for Newcastle and captained the Premier League side for much of his time at St James' Park.

He has featured just twice for the Magpies since March 2024 when he suffered a serious knee injury that ruled him for the entirety of last season.

Lascelles' final appearance for the club came off the bench in September's 2-1 defeat by Arsenal.

Southampton loan midfielder Aribo to Leicester

Moves were made by Championship club Leicester to sign the defender on transfer deadline day on Monday but delays with processing paperwork meant his arrival was confirmed a day later.

Lascelles, who last played in the Championship when he helped Newcastle to promotion in 2016-17, joins a managerless Foxes side that is struggling in the bottom half of the second-tier table.

He also previously played in the Championship for Leicester's East Midlands rivals Nottingham Forest, the club where he came through as a teenager and made his professional debut in 2012.

"I'm buzzing to get through the door," he told the Foxes website.

"I just can't wait to help out as much as I can, try to push us up the league," he said.

title: Richard Hughes torn to shreds by Premier League legend
description: Paul Merson slams Richard Hughes' summer transfer business for LiverpoolThe transfers of Alexander Isak and Florian Wirtz were two of the biggest in Liverpool's history.The duo were seen as the best w...
fullText:
The transfers of Alexander Isak and Florian Wirtz were two of the biggest in Liverpool's history.

The duo were seen as the best way for Liverpool to take their next step and to even replace Mohamed Salah in the future.

And, while Wirtz is finally getting back to his best, it's clear that some new signings still need to be made at Liverpool.

This has caused plenty of confusion among the football world, with Paul Merson now slamming the recruitment process undertaken by Hughes.

"With all the money Liverpool have spent, the squad looks wafer-thin," Merson told Sky Sports in quotes relayed by The Mirror.

"Looking at it now, they got it horribly wrong in the summer.

"By going bang, bang with a load of attackers and thinking they were going to dominate English football for the next four or five years, it's backfired."

Even though attackers were needed to replace Darwin Nunez and Luis Diaz at Liverpool, they still spent far too much money.

Isak and Wirtz alone cost the Anfield outfit around ¬£240 million, which, for any team is a massive chunk of change.

The Reds have often spent their money wisely and have chosen to upgrade multiple areas of their squad, rather than splashing the cash in one place.

Although the chances of a new player arriving before January's deadline day look slim, that doesn't mean that they can't eye up potential targets for the 2026-27 summer window.

However, if Hughes, Slot and Edwards do end up drafting up a shortlist of potential targets, they must ensure that their entire squad is benefitting, rather than just one area of it.

Otherwise, they could end up in the same situation all over again next year.

title: Three likely draft destinations for LSU football corner Mansoor Delane
description: Former LSU cornerback Mansoor Delane is expected to be selected early in the 2026 NFL Draft. Here are three ideal fits for the former Tiger.
fullText:
Former LSU football cornerback Mansoor Delane made his mark during his lone season at LSU, earning first-team All-American honors and finishing as a finalist for the Jim Thorpe Award, which is given to the nation‚Äôs top defensive back.

His impressive 2025 campaign has firmly put him in the conversation for an early first-round pick in the NFL Draft in April. Where he might come off the board is up for debate, with some mock drafts having him go in the early to mid-teens, while one recent mock draft had him taken in the top five.

The goal of this piece is to take a look at some teams that fit the former Tiger best, but his notoriety limits the options to some extent. It‚Äôs highly unlikely Delane makes it past the middle of the first round, so we‚Äôre going to limit the available options to teams who are projected to be within range to select him.

This isn‚Äôt only a great fit because Delane would be joining two former Tigers in Cincinnati, though that certainly heightens the intrigue for LSU fans. The Bengals had one of the NFL‚Äôs worst passing defenses in 2025, ranking in the bottom quartile of the league in passing EPA/Play, passing success rate allowed, and explosive pass percentage allowed, according to ESPN‚Äôs Sam Hoppen.

Giving them a corner with Delane‚Äôs talent has proven to be a major factor in turning around defenses in the past, and there are few in the league who need that sort of talent injection more than Cincinnati.

The Rams were one of the NFL‚Äôs best teams this season, and a draft-day trade with the Falcons last offseason landed them what has become the 13th overall pick. Although their defense certainly wasn‚Äôt a terrible unit by league standards, their passing defense certainly wasn‚Äôt a strength, allowing 7.6 yards per pass attempt this season.

Many mock drafts have the Rams selecting Tennessee cornerback Jermod McCoy over Delane, but Delane feels like the more likely ‚Äî and smart ‚Äî pick. This Rams team wants to maximize its Super Bowl window while Matthew Stafford is still playing, and McCoy didn‚Äôt play a snap in 2025 due to an injury during the 2024 college football playoff. Despite concerns about Delane‚Äôs size and athleticism, he offers the Rams elite coverage play that they don‚Äôt have to draft based on year-old tape.

The Jets are a distinctly different situation from the Rams. This isn‚Äôt a team trying to max out a Super Bowl window; it‚Äôs a team that‚Äôs trying to reload a defensive roster that‚Äôs devoid of talent. The draft strategy that works best for a team like this is taking the best player available, and if Delane is still on the board at 16, he certainly qualifies.

Additionally, Delane would be a great fit for Aaron Glenn‚Äôs man-coverage-heavy defense. According to Pro Football Focus, Delane posted the second-best man-coverage grade among Power Four cornerbacks in 2025, meshing perfectly with a Jets defense that ran man coverage fourth-most in the league this season.

This article originally appeared on LSU Wire: Three likely draft destinations for LSU football corner Mansoor Delane

title: No guarantee winner of Evloev vs. Murphy main event at UFC London gets next Volkanovski title shot
description: It‚Äôs finally official: top featherweight contenders Movsar Evloev and Lerone Murphy will fight each other in the main event of UFC London, going down on March 21st, 2026. Evloev and Murphy are ranked No. 1 and No. 3 respectively on the 145 pound rankings, and champion Alexander Volkanovski has been calling for a fight against [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
It‚Äôs finally official: top featherweight contenders Movsar Evloev and Lerone Murphy will fight each other in the main event of UFC London, going down on March 21st, 2026.

Evloev and Murphy are ranked No. 1 and No. 3 respectively on the 145 pound rankings, and champion Alexander Volkanovski has been calling for a fight against one or another since he beat No. 2 ranked Diego Lopes the first time in April 2025. But as of now there‚Äôs no guarantee the winner of Evloev vs. Murphy will get the next shot at Volk.

Lerone Murphy discussed the situation with Ariel Helwani, revealing there was no title shot guarantee that came with the main event booking.

‚ÄúEeeeh, at this point, words are wind, innit?‚Äù Murphy said. ‚ÄúThe division is forever changing. It‚Äôs a performance-based company, someone‚Äôs got to go out there and put on a good fight and then? Nothing‚Äôs concrete. But I hope so.‚Äù

The UFC has been hyper-focused on excitement as a metric for earning title shots, and Murphy suggested it would be hard to earn an exciting win off an opponent like Movsar Evloev.

‚ÄúI believe the matchmakers know what kind of match this is,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI think it would be unfair to say you‚Äôve got to go out there and get a crazy knockout to get a title shot. Everybody knows what kind of fight this is going to be and what type of fighter I‚Äôm fighting against. So I think the winner should be undeniably next in line for the title. Simple.‚Äù

If there‚Äôs one person out there banging the drum for Movsar or Lerone to get a shot, it‚Äôs Alexander Volkanovski himself. If excitement and popularity is the metric, then it would be easy for UFC to slot No. 6 ranked Jean Silva into a title fight. But ‚ÄúThe Great‚Äù is clearly unenthused about that fight.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôve got Silva obviously probably trying to get his name out there,‚Äù Volkanovski said in a new interview. ‚ÄúNow he‚Äôs saying some stuff and thinking he really deserves next. If the UFC obviously were to push that for me, everyone knows me. I‚Äôll fight anyone. But I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs very likely to happen.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs in a position to fight for the title, especially when you‚Äôve got Lerone Murphy and Movsar Evloev fighting very, very soon. I think that‚Äôs very clear.‚Äù

Only if you‚Äôre looking at things in terms of win streaks and rankings and not social media popularity and action. The winner of Murphy vs. Evloev may leave London with a ten fight win streak compared to Silva‚Äôs one. But Silva surfed on his opponent‚Äôs back at the end of his last fight, which we must admit was pretty cool.

Cool enough to earn a title shot? In today‚Äôs UFC, maybe.

title: Dana White reportedly lining up Tyson Fury vs Anthony Joshua in Netflix superfight
description: Dana White‚Äôs latest venture into boxing might be about to shake up the sport in a big way, with reports suggesting Zuffa Boxing is closing in on a fight fans have wanted for years. So far, Zuffa Boxing has only put on two shows.
fullText:
Dana White‚Äôs latest venture into boxing might be about to shake up the sport in a big way, with reports suggesting Zuffa Boxing is closing in on a fight fans have wanted for years.

So far, Zuffa Boxing has only put on two shows. But given White‚Äôs long track record of promoting major events in combat sports, there‚Äôs already plenty of buzz around what he could bring to boxing. That reputation now faces a real test, as talks are swirling around what could be one of the sport‚Äôs most anticipated matchups.

According to BoxingScene, the matchup between Nate Diaz and Paulie Malignaggi has been verbally agreed, marking one of the more unexpected turns this year. The two have a history going back several years over comments Malignaggi made about Nate and Nick Diaz.

Tyson Fury and Anthony Joshua have been linked to a fight for years without ever sharing the ring. The closest they came was an early sparring session during their youth, long before their professional careers took off. That may be about to change, though.

It is being reported by BoxingScene that Dana White is planning to stage the fight on Zuffa Boxing, with Netflix likely to broadcast it. Reports suggest that Netflix will also be involved in Fury‚Äôs upcoming April fight against Arslanbek Makhmudov, adding to their growing presence in live sports.

A car accident last year left Joshua injured and cost him two close friends. However, he has since returned to training and recently released a video addressing the loss of his friends and his journey back.

Fury hasn‚Äôt fought since back-to-back defeats against Oleksandr Usyk in Saudi Arabia. Joshua‚Äôs last appearance was a knockout win over Jake Paul on another Netflix card just days before his accident.

Dana White didn‚Äôt hold back his excitement after Zuffa Boxing 2, hinting that the promotion is ready to make some noise in the industry. Speaking at the post-fight press conference, he suggested big news is on the way.

‚ÄúWe have some pretty crazy announcements coming over the next few weeks,‚Äù he said, without naming any specific dates or fighters. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm way further in this thing than I anticipated being two shows in.‚Äù

White added: ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot going on to rock the industry ‚Äì new signings, more deals, new territories. I‚Äôm telling you guys by the end of 2026, it‚Äôs going to be impressive.‚Äù

White has plenty of experience in boxing promotion already. He was involved with Tom Loeffler‚Äôs work for Callum Walsh, including a Dublin event in 2024 and also promoted last year‚Äôs Canelo Alvarez vs Terence Crawford bout.

title: Insider reveals Man Utd plans to sign ¬£39m ‚Äòstreets‚Äô star hailed as the best product since Haaland
description: Manchester United are keeping close tabs on RB Leipzig teenager Yan Diomande, who is considered one of the best prospects in Europe at the moment.The 19-year-old was born and raised in the Ivory Coast...
fullText:
Manchester United are keeping close tabs on RB Leipzig teenager Yan Diomande, who is considered one of the best prospects in Europe at the moment.

The 19-year-old was born and raised in the Ivory Coast, but started his career in the United States at the academies of Yulee Hornets and DME. In January 2025, he entered the European scene through the gates of Leganes and swiftly managed to grab the limelight, especially following a particularly delightful performance against Real Madrid.

Last summer, RB Leipzig splashed ‚Ç¨20 million to secure his services after receiving the nod of approval from Jurgen Klopp.

Since then, he has established himself as one of the most exciting players in the Bundesliga and has also been labelled as the best product for the Red Bull system since Man City striker Erling Haaland. This season, has contributed with eight goals and six assists in 21 appearances for the German club.

As reported earlier today, David Ornstein confirmed that Man Utd‚Äôs plans for next summer include signing a new left winger, especially after missing out on Antoine Semenyo last month.

Last summer, United shelled out ¬£62.5 million on Matheus Cunha, who has been justifying this figure with his impressive displays. Nonetheless, the club still needs an additional option down the left flank, having parted ways with Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho.

(Photo by Maja Hitij/Getty Images)

According to Manchester World reporter Rich Fay, Diomande is an early favourite for this role.

It should also be noted that Fabrizio Romano had revealed that Man Utd and Tottenham are among several European clubs that scouted Diomande this season.

With his blistering pace and effortless ability to skip past his marker, the young Ivorian has been an absolute menace for opposition players.

In a past interview, Diomande revealed that, despite his academy training, he remains a street player at heart.

‚ÄúI played in the streets. I still play when I go home ‚Äì sometimes with friends. I like to say: I left the streets, but the streets did not leave me. It is still part of me,‚Äù said the Abidjan native.

Moreover, Diomande is a good friend of Amad Diallo, who would help him adjust to life at Carrington. The two wingers play on opposite flanks for the Ivorian national team, causing havoc for their opponents.

While we can expect several twists and turns between now and the summer, the Leipzig wonderkid is certainly one to keep a close eye on in the coming months.

title: 'No panic' over Ireland's injury list - Sheehan
description: Ireland hooker Dan Sheehan says there is "confidence" in the players still available for Thursday's opening Six Nations match against France in Paris.
fullText:
Ireland hooker Dan Sheehan says there is "confidence" in the players still available for Thursday's opening Six Nations match against France in Paris (20:10 GMT).

Head coach Andy Farrell named his team for the game on Tuesday morning and is without several usual starters through injury.

Tadhg Furlong, Hugo Keenan, Ryan Baird and Mack Hansen are all out through injury, while Bundee Aki is suspended.

Perhaps most problematic is the absence of not just usual loose-head Andrew Porter but also his two primary back-ups in Paddy McCarthy and Jack Boyle.

In their place, Jeremy Loughman will win a first cap since the 2024 Six Nations, with his Munster colleague Michael Milne providing cover from the bench.

"We have confidence in the people we have," said Sheehan.

"We have done a good job of building some good depth over the years and we have got some loose-heads that have caps.

"Some teams would struggle [with the injuries] but I think we have good depth and people to come in. I don't think much has changed and there has been no sense of panic."

Despite concerns over front row depth with Ireland down their three first-choice loose-heads, and starting tight-head Tadhg Furlong missing at least the opener, Sheehan's own position of hooker is one where Farrell has an enviable set of options.

Sheehan will start ahead of his Leinster team-mate Ronan Kelleher in Paris with Ulster's Tom Stewart also having impressed for Ulster this year.

"We have some top-quality young hookers across the provinces now," Sheehan continued.

"If you look at a few years ago, maybe people said there was a shortage, but I think all the provinces are producing quality hookers and that drives everyone on."

The past four editions of the Six Nations have been won by either Ireland or Les Bleus. Farrell's side haven't won against Thursday's hosts at the Stade de France since 2018, although did beat Scotland and South Africa at the ground during the 2023 World Cup.

"When people ask "where is your favourite away stadium?", it is the Stade de France, it is a great atmosphere," Sheehan added.

"The Six Nations is always so special, it is always the best two months of the year.

"[The start of the year can be] some boring months, but it always gives people a lift and us a lift. Everyone is buzzing to get going now."

title: Report: Man City draw up three-man shortlist of potential Pep Guardiola replacements
description: Guardiola succession planning gathers momentum at Manchester CityGrowing discussion around Manchester City and life after Pep Guardiola has moved firmly into the open, with The Telegraph reporting tha...
fullText:
Growing discussion around Manchester City and life after Pep Guardiola has moved firmly into the open, with The Telegraph reporting that Xabi Alonso is expected to feature on a three man shortlist to succeed the Catalan. Despite public denials from City sources, there is an unmistakable sense across Premier League circles that contingency planning has begun.

City‚Äôs recent wobble has sharpened the focus. A damaging draw at Tottenham, having led by two goals, left them six points adrift of Arsenal and fuelled questions about whether Guardiola‚Äôs era is reaching its natural conclusion. Rivals sense vulnerability, while internally there is acknowledgement that even dynasties require succession.

Guardiola‚Äôs position remains officially secure. City announced in November 2024 that he had signed a two year extension through to 2027, a statement designed to quell speculation. Yet football operates as much on mood as on paperwork. Guardiola‚Äôs absence from media duties following a return to Barcelona for a speech supporting Palestinian children added to the sense of distance during a pivotal week.

City have dismissed talk of his departure as ‚Äúpure speculation‚Äù, but speculation has rarely travelled this far without oxygen. One source quoted by Telegraph Sport offered a telling observation: ‚ÄúTottenham were there for the taking, but City weren‚Äôt ruthless. They let them off the hook. Some of the players look like they think Pep is leaving at the end of the season and, as a result, they are going through the motions.‚Äù

Alonso, recently dismissed by Real Madrid, is viewed as a coach of stature and composure, capable of handling elite environments. His association with Liverpool adds edge to the narrative, particularly with Arne Slot under pressure to deliver Champions League qualification. City already moved ahead of Liverpool for Marc Gu√©hi and Antoine Semenyo, and repeating that trick for Alonso would sting.

Enzo Maresca, once Guardiola‚Äôs assistant, is also expected to be considered. Recently dismissed by Chelsea, Maresca had informed Chelsea of talks with City and Juventus. His candidacy is complicated by timing and competition, but familiarity counts.

Another name gaining traction is Cesc Fabregas, admired for his work at Como, who sit sixth in Serie A. Fabregas is expected to leave only for an elite role, and City would qualify.

Former City captain Vincent Kompany is not expected to leave Bayern Munich, having extended his deal to 2029 and embedded himself in transfer planning. Roberto De Zerbi, previously admired, faces uncertainty at Marseille after Champions League disappointment.

Responsibility for shaping the shortlist will fall to Hugo Viana, City‚Äôs director of football, whose relationship with super agent Jorge Mendes brings additional intrigue. Guardiola himself may yet be consulted, an echo of the club‚Äôs preference for continuity and control.

For now, nothing is decided. But elite clubs plan before they are forced to act. City are doing precisely that.

There is pride in what Guardiola has built and anxiety at the thought of losing the defining figure of the modern club. Six league titles, relentless standards and a global identity do not vanish cleanly.

At the same time, succession planning feels sensible rather than disloyal. Fans understand that even Guardiola will not stay forever, and the idea that City are calmly mapping the future is reassuring. Alonso appeals as a thinker and a leader, someone who respects structure and intelligence, values City supporters recognise. Maresca offers continuity, Fabregas imagination.

What would concern fans more is drift. The quote about players ‚Äúgoing through the motions‚Äù resonates because City have always thrived on intensity and clarity. If Guardiola is staying, supporters want renewed conviction. If he is going, then decisive planning matters.

Ultimately, City fans trust the hierarchy. The club has earned belief that transitions will be managed with foresight rather than panic, and that whoever follows Guardiola will inherit a platform built to keep winning.

title: Arsenal sign top academy talent from Scotland
description: Arsenal have signed promising academy talent Evan Mooney from Scottish Premiership side St Mirren.Mooney has joined the Arsenal academy and can play as an attacking midfield or a striker. He has made ...
fullText:
Arsenal have signed promising academy talent Evan Mooney from Scottish Premiership side St Mirren.

Mooney has joined the Arsenal academy and can play as an attacking midfield or a striker. He has made 23 appearances in all competitions for St Mirren since making his senior debut at the beginning of the 2024/25 campaign, and is 18-years-old.

The forward is a Scottish international and has made six appearances for his country at under-19 level.

Arsenal had also held talks with Hearts regarding another Scottish teenager, James Wilson, but he ultimately decided to join their bitter rivals Tottenham.

It was in the end a quiet transfer window for the Gunners, and they are next in action against Chelsea in the second leg of the Carabao Cup semi-final.

They go into the game with a 3-2 lead on aggregate.

title: üö® BREAKING: Leicester City announce post-deadline day double deal
description: Leicester City have added a blend of youth and experience with a pair of post-transfer deadline day arrivals.First up, Jamaal Lascelles has joined from Newcastle, where he spent over a decade at the h...
fullText:
Leicester City have added a blend of youth and experience with a pair of post-transfer deadline day arrivals.

First up, Jamaal Lascelles has joined from Newcastle, where he spent over a decade at the heart of defence.

The ex-Magpies skipper helped the club to end their 70-year wait for a domestic trophy with EFL Cup success last season.

Lascelles, 32, has signed on a free transfer and penned a short-term deal until the end of the season.

Joining him in making the move to the Midlands is talented Manchester City youngster Divine Mukasa, who comes in on loan.

He has made six senior appearances for the Cityzens to date and the deal does not include an option to purchase the 18-year-old permanently.

üì∏ Stu Forster - 2025 Getty Images

title: Predicting upsets in College Basketball this week
description: To this point in the season, we haven‚Äôt had a ton of major upsets among the top teams in the country. In fact, the top 10 teams in the AP poll have a combined 16 losses, an average of 1.6‚Ä¶
fullText:
To this point in the season, we haven‚Äôt had a ton of major upsets among the top teams in the country. In fact, the top 10 teams in the AP poll have a combined 16 losses, an average of 1.6 per team. That means one of two things ‚Äì either the teams at the top of the sport have really separated themselves from the rest of the nation, or they‚Äôre due for some regression! Let‚Äôs see what happens over the next month and a half!

The Wolfpack have really hit their stride as of late, running their offense behind a pick-and-roll and pick-and-pop scheme with Quadir Copeland handling the ball, Derrion Williams setting the screen, and Paul McNeil and Tre Hollomon spacing the floor. It‚Äôs fun to watch, and I don‚Äôt think that SMU is going to have any answers for it, lacking the personnel to switch on the screen.

MORE: ESPN, NFL finalize billion-dollar media deal after government approval

The year is 2026, and the Blue Demons finally have a home-court advantage. In Big East play, DePaul has only lost once at home, and it was to the top-of-the-conference UConn Huskies. CJ Gunn is the type of scorer who can catch fire and ignite an entire arena, and I think Tuesday is the night when DePaul is officially back on the map.

Cross-country road trips have meant doom in the Big Ten this season. Here we have Iowa traveling to the Pacific Northwest to take on a healthy and rejuvenated Washington team with Wesley Yates and Jacob Ognacevic back. Plus, the stylings of Ben McCollum generally lead to low-possession games where upsets are more likely.

The Redhawks are still unbeaten heading into February, but they are starting to show some cracks. On Saturday, they trailed Northern Illinois by double-digits before coming back to win. In the first meeting between these two teams, Miami needed overtime and then a buzzer-beating 3-pointer to come out victorious on their home floor. Now the game is in Buffalo, and the Bulls are hungry for revenge.

Winning in the Fertitta Center is never easy, but if Johnny Dawkins‚Äô squad is good enough to beat Texas Tech, they can take down Houston, too. Stylistically, I think this is a good matchup for UCF. Houston loves to blitz and trap ball screens, and UCF has smart ball-handlers who should be able to handle the pressure and make good decisions. I think it‚Äôs quite likely that UCF‚Äôs forwards can get Houston into foul trouble.

title: Miami Dolphins must invest in defense and trenches, SB 60 proves | Schad
description: The Miami Dolphins have hired a defensive-minded coach, like New England and Seattle. Now, like those teams, they should load up on defense.
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots will play for Super Bowl 60 on Sunday, Feb. 8, in Santa Clara, Calif.

And these teams have a lot in common.

Yes, as Bear Bryant once famously said, "defensive wins championships."

The Seahawks are coached by Mike Macdonald, former NFL defensive coordinator.

The Patriots are coaches by Mike Vrabel, former NFL defensive coordinator.

The Seahawks are 6th in the NFL in total defense.

The Patriots are 8th in the NFL in total defense.

The Seahawks are 3rd in the NFL in run defense.

The Patriots are 7th in the NFL in run defense.

What's my point? The Miami Dolphins must build up their defense to have a chance to compete at this level.

The Dolphins have made one step in the right direction, hiring strong Packers defensive coordinator Jeff Hafley as their leader.

Hafley has already been preaching all the right things about toughness, physicality and relentlessness.

Hafley has said the notion of the Dolphins as a "soft" team basically makes him sick.

Now general manager Jon-Eric Sullivan must invest more into Miami's defense than offense.

Specifically, Sullivan must look to build Miami's defensive trenches.

The Seahawks and Patriots have invested on the interior defensive front, and it's paid dividends.

According to Spotrac, the Seahawks are 12th in the NFL in average value of contract for defensive tackles.

And the Patriots are 4th in the NFL in average value of contract for defensive tackles.

In so many words, pay up for the big boys. Pay up for the monsters who can penetrate up the middle and dominate against the run.

"You have to, to make sure that your line of scrimmage on both sides of the ball is big, tough, resilient and that there's depth," the Dolphins' GM Sullivan said, on the day he was introduced.

In their roster-building, the Seahawks and Patriots both leaned toward investments on defense.

What if I told you Seattle was last in percentage of NFL cap devoted to offense in 2025?

What if I told you New England was 24th in NFL cap spending on offense in 2025?

The pendulum is swinging in this league and it's swinging toward defense.

The Patriots are paying big bucks for interior linemen Milton Williams and Christian Barmore.

The Seahawks are paying big bucks for interior lineman Leonard Williams and used a recent first-rounder on Byron Murphy.

The Dolphins need to invest in big people, and especially big people on defense.

Miami Dolphins free agency: Top 5 players to prioritize; the salaries

Joe Schad is a journalist covering the¬†Miami Dolphins¬†and the NFL at¬†The Palm Beach Post. You can reach him at¬†jschad@pbpost.com¬†and follow him on¬†Instagram¬†and on X¬†@schadjoe. Help support our work¬†by subscribing today.

title: Ex-Milan and Juventus defender admits he snubbed Liverpool move
description: Former Milan and Juventus defender Mattia De Sciglio said he snubbed a move to Liverpool to move to Turin in 2017, but he felt ‚Äòused‚Äô by Vincenzo Montella at San Siro.Former Italy international De...
fullText:
Former Milan and Juventus defender Mattia De Sciglio said he snubbed a move to Liverpool to move to Turin in 2017, but he felt ‚Äòused‚Äô by Vincenzo Montella at San Siro.

Former Italy international De Sciglio spoke about his career in an interview with Corriere della Sera.

A product of the Milan academy, De Sciglio has also played for Juventus and Empoli in Serie A and Lyon in the French Ligue 1.

The 33-year-old has collected 208 appearances in Serie A and 28 in the Champions League.

‚ÄúI could have played for Inter as a kid,‚Äù De Sciglio said via Calciomercato.com.

‚ÄúThey had called me for a trial, but I was dropped because I was too short. Milan arrived shortly afterwards, and I went through the youth sector until my Champions League debut at 18.‚Äù

De Sciglio was a Milan first-team player in one of the darkest moments in recent history, but feels the way he was treated at San Siro was unfair.

‚ÄúSome of the fans and the media identified me as the guilty one in that situation, and they were all waiting for a minimum error to criticise me,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúMy social media accounts were filled with insults and nasty comments, but I had always behaved well, so I didn‚Äôt understand.‚Äù

During a Milan home game against Empoli in April 2017, he realised he had to leave the Rossoneri.

DORTMUND, GERMANY ‚Äì JUNE 18: Vincenzo Montella, Head Coach of Turkiye, gestures during the UEFA EURO 2024 group stage match between Turkiye and Georgia at Football Stadium Dortmund on June 18, 2024 in Dortmund, Germany. (Photo by Dean Mouhtaropoulos/Getty Images)

‚ÄúWe were down two goals at minute 70, and Montella decided to replace me. I was angry. It‚Äôs a substitution I‚Äôve never understood. It seemed just a way to use me to hide a difficult moment for the whole team,‚Äù De Sciglio said.

‚ÄúAs I was leaving, a boos erupted all around me. That day, I realised I could no longer go on like that; my story with Milan was over.‚Äù

TURIN, ITALY ‚Äì FEBRUARY 02: Kenan Yildiz of Juventus battles for possession with Mattia De Sciglio of Empoli during the Serie A match between Juventus and Empoli at Allianz Stadium on February 02, 2025 in Turin, Italy. (Photo by Valerio Pennicino/Getty Images)

The following summer, De Sciglio joined Juventus from Milan.

‚ÄúLiverpool also wanted me, but I picked Turin because Allegri was on the bench and the team was really strong,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúFinding myself in a dressing room of champions and playing European games as a protagonist was a nice revenge after a difficult period.‚Äù

De Sciglio is currently without a club as Juventus didn‚Äôt extend his contract when he returned from a loan spell at Empoli at the end of 2024-25.

title: Lerone Murphy makes frank admission despite theories around UFC London fight
description: Murphy and Evloev will clash in the main event, but will the winner be next for featherweight king Alexander Volkanovski?
fullText:
Lerone Murphy has admitted that his UFC London main event against Movsar Evloev may not be a No 1 contender‚Äôs fight, despite theories from many figures in MMA.

On 21 March, Manchester‚Äôs Murphy will face the Russian in a battle of unbeaten featherweights, with champion Alexander Volkanovski keen to face the winner.

Naturally, then, many fans and pundits have been quick to dub the UFC London main event a No 1 contender‚Äôs bout, given Murphy and Evloev‚Äôs impressive records and Volkanovski‚Äôs desire to face either man.

Yet it isn‚Äôt always that simple in the UFC, as Murphy noted on Monday, shortly after his fight was announced. ‚ÄúNothing‚Äôs concrete,‚Äù he said on The Ariel Helwani Show.

Still, Murphy added: ‚ÄúBut I hope so. The matchmakers know what type of match-up this is. Everyone knows what type of fight this is going to be, and what type of fighter I‚Äôm fighting against.

‚ÄúSo, I think the winner should be undeniably next in line for the title. Simple.‚Äù

Murphy, who will carry a 17-0-1 record into the O2 Arena, said of the 19-0 Evloev: ‚ÄúMovsar is elite. He‚Äôs a very good fighter, good everywhere, but I just believe I‚Äôm going to take him into deep waters.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be defensive wrestling, an ambitious offence, and pressure him to make a mistake. I‚Äôll be hunting for the knockout from bell to bell.‚Äù

News of the match-up came just two days after Volkanovski extended his second reign as featherweight champion with a win over Diego Lopes. Volkanovski outpointed Lopes to retain the title in the main event of UFC 325, nine months after beating the Brazilian in the same manner to win the vacant belt.

And the Australian champion used his post-fight press conference to call for a fight with Murphy, 34, or Evloev, 31, next.

‚ÄúIt hurt watching that fight, thinking I should have been there,‚Äù Murphy said. ‚ÄúIt should have been me [...] I think if I was in there, I would have gotten the job done.

‚ÄúI see a lot of things in there that I would have been doing. I feel, right now, that I‚Äôm the best in the world at featherweight.

‚ÄúVolk is the guy I have the utmost respect for as a champion. If it were up to him, he would have fought me, and he‚Äôs going out there and fighting the next best. It‚Äôs how every champion should be. Hopefully I get the chance to share the Octagon with him.‚Äù

Murphy last fought in August, taking on UFC debutant Aaron Pico. The Briton stopped the former Bellator star in stunning fashion, with a spinning back elbow, which led Volkanovski to call for a title defence against Murphy.

Meanwhile, Evloev has not fought since December 2024, when he narrowly outpointed Aljamain Sterling, a former bantamweight champion in the UFC.

title: Iconic Ouninpohja stage dropped from 2026 WRC Rally Finland route
description: Rally Finland will offer WRC crews new challenges this year
fullText:
The iconic Ouninpohja stage, regarded as one of most revered in the World Rally Championship, has been dropped from Rally Finland this year as part of an event itinerary revamp.

The 32.98km gravel rollercoaster, which has earned cult status over the years, made its return to Rally Finland in 2024 after a then-seven-year hiatus. Last year, the stage became the Super Sunday centrepiece as two runs through the test, in front of bumper crowds, provided the climax to the rally ‚Äì which was won by Kalle Rovanpera.

However, Rally Finland organisers have made significant changes to the route for this year‚Äôs event (30 July - 2 August), which will see Ouninpohja absent from the schedule. However, the the successful Super Sunday ‚Äì one stage, two passes ‚Äì concept that it started last year will remain in 2026.

Ouninpohja will be replaced by the 30km Himos-Jamsa stage, which will be run twice to conclude the rally. The stage opens on a fast Vaheri public road and transitions into narrower private roads in the middle section, and finishes spectacularly at the foot of the Himos ski slopes within a compact event village.

‚ÄúWe have a strong ambition not to run the same route two years in a row. In 2026, 66% of the special stages are different compared to last year, and the rally must keep evolving to remain exciting for both drivers and spectators,‚Äù said Kai Tarkiainen, Rally Finland clerk of the course.

According to the organisers ‚Äúthe 2026 route reflects both the 75-year history of Rally Finland and bold new openings. It features sections inspired by classic decades of the event, alongside roads that have never before been used in a FIA World Rally Championship event.‚Äù

New FIA regulations introduced for the current season require a more compact overall structure, with special stages now accounting for at least one quarter of the total itinerary. This has demanded significant structural solutions.

‚ÄúStage lengths, liaison distances and geographical logic must all work together, but sporting quality is always the top priority,‚Äù said Kari Nuutinen, deputy clerk of the course responsible for the route.

‚ÄúWe have now achieved a route that meets all requirements and remains extremely compact yet highly diverse.‚Äù

The most significant changes to the route take place on Friday, which features 127.94 competitive kilometres. Nearly half of the day‚Äôs roads have never been driven in the WRC era.

Friday‚Äôs itinerary includes Laukaa run in a new direction, Saarikas, the all-new Sydanmaa special stage combining the former Sirkkamaki and Kalliokoski roads, the completely new Hoho stage, and the evening highlight, the Harju Super Special Stage in downtown Jyvaskyla.

Saturday is built around a fast and rhythmical package, with liaison sections shortened to be more driver-friendly. The day starts near Jyvaskyla in Parkkola and continues through Paijala and Vastila before reaching Leustu in Korpilahti before Sunday‚Äôs climax.

description: N‚ÄôGolo Kant√© remains on the sidelines.According to an official statement from Fenerbah√ße, the transfer with Al-Ittihad could not be completed, despite an agreement being reached and medical examin...
fullText:
N‚ÄôGolo Kant√© remains on the sidelines.

According to an official statement from Fenerbah√ße, the transfer with Al-Ittihad could not be completed, despite an agreement being reached and medical examinations being approved.

All documents were reportedly submitted on time by the Turkish side, but administrative errors on the Saudi side caused the deal to fall through.

The Istanbul club specified that Al-Ittihad had entered some information incorrectly into FIFA‚Äôs system (TMS), preventing the transfer from being finalized within the deadline.

Fenerbah√ße then requested an extension and took all necessary steps with FIFA, but to no avail.

Another consequence of this administrative blunder: Moroccan international Youssef En-Nesyri will not be making the move in the opposite direction. Unfortunate.

The Turkish club concluded its statement by expressing its disappointment.
